thread.title: Blatche OKs return to Gilas – SBP
thread.title_full: Blatche OKs return to Gilas – SBP | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Waylon Galvez
title: Blatche OKs return to Gilas – SBP
text:
by Waylon Galvez
October 16, 2015 Andray Blatche is expected to play for Gilas Pilipinas in next year’s Olympic Qualifying Tournament.
Gilas team manager Butch Antonio said yesterday that the Samahang Basketbol ng Pilipinas (SBP) talked with the 6-foot-11 Blatche following the FIBA Asia Championship in Changsha, China and the former NBA player said he was ready to play for his adopted country.
“After our stint in the FIBA Asia, Andray told us that he’s ready to play in the qualifier, so there’s nothing to worry. We’ll still have Andray as naturalized player,” Antonio told the Bulletin.
“We also spoke with his management team, and we informed them that we’ll compete in the qualifying tournament,” added Antonio, deputy director for international affairs of the SBP.
Blatche’s contract expired after the Asian Championship but Antonio said there is an agreement between the two camps regarding Gilas’ next competition.
Blatche, who now plays for the Xinjiang Flying Tigers in the Chinese Basketball Association, made his Gilas debut last year at the FIBA World Cup in Spain.
He was one of the top performers for Gilas during its run to the championship game where they eventually lost to host China.
